text: Hello everyone! I have a question about clearing protocol, so maybe you can help in this group :slightly_smiling_face: We are going to try iDISCO but we are struggling a bit to find glass vials to keep the samples. We want the vials to be not more than 5-10 mL total volume (so we save DBE) but the bottle neck should be around 1.5-2 mm if we want to be able to introduce our specimens... any of you can recommend glass vials that you have in your places? All 5 mL vials we find have a bottle neck diameter of 1 or 1.3 mm :disappointed: THANKS A LOT!!

elements.text: Hello everyone! I have a question about clearing protocol, so maybe you can help in this group

We are going to try iDISCO but we are struggling a bit to find glass vials to keep the samples. We want the vials to be not more than 5-10 mL total volume (so we save DBE) but the bottle neck should be around 1.5-2 mm if we want to be able to introduce our specimens... any of you can recommend glass vials that you have in your places? All 5 mL vials we find have a bottle neck diameter of 1 or 1.3 mm

text:
I don't have any suggestions for glass vials to use, I usually see people using something like a 25 mL vial. but only putting 10 mL in there.

If you punch holes in a polystyrene box/lid/cube, you could secure the vials upright, if that is what you are worried about? I.e. not immersing the sample fully in the solution if the vial is tipped

elements.text:
I don't have any suggestions for glass vials to use, I usually see people using something like a 25 mL vial. but only putting 10 mL in there.

If you punch holes in a polystyrene box/lid/cube, you could secure the vials upright, if that is what you are worried about? I.e. not immersing the sample fully in the solution if the vial is tipped

text:
Hi Alvaro,
Like Rob, I also see people use 20 - 25 mL glass vials with iDISCO-derived protocol and only use 3 - 5 mL incubation volume. Alternatively, I have also seen a certain type of EP tubes that are compatible with DBE and DCM. That will for sure limit the incubation volume :wink:

Adipo-Clear is a protocol adapted from iDISCO/iDISCO+ that uses also DCM and DBE. In their publication, they suggested to ''Use glass containers for storage and microcentrifuge tubes (polypropylene) for incubations''. <https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6126572/>

Hope that you find something that suits your samples and protocol!
Sunny

attachments.fallback: PubMed Central (PMC): Adipo-Clear: A Tissue Clearing Method for Three-Dimensional Imaging of Adipose Tissue
attachments.text: Adipose tissue plays a central role in energy homeostasis and thermoregulation. It is composed of different types of adipocytes, as well as adipocyte precursors, immune cells, fibroblasts, blood vessels, and nerve projections. Although the molecular control ...
attachments.title: Adipo-Clear: A Tissue Clearing Method for Three-Dimensional Imaging of Adipose Tissue

text: Many thanks both of you :slightly_smiling_face: I will check the adipo-clear and write to EP, if not, I will go for bigger vials... I think you should fill them completely to avoid solvent oxidation... and I wanted to save a little bit of solvent. But should be fine! Thanks!
